item.title: Siemens Ltd. Q3 FY26: Profit Plunges 55% Amid Margin Pressures
item.description: Siemens Ltd., India's second-largest heavy electrical equipment manufacturer, reported a disappointing third quarter for FY2026, with consolidated net profit plummeting 54.86% year-on-year to ₹277.30 crores from ₹614.30 crores in Q3 FY25. The sharp decline came despite a modest 14.01% revenue growth, as the company grappled with margin pressures and reduced other income. Following the results announcement, the stock declined 3.71% to close at ₹3,177.20 on February 6, 2026, reflecting investor concerns about the deteriorating profitability trajectory. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Bannari Amman Sugars Q3 FY26: Strong Quarter Masks Valuation Concerns
item.description: Bannari Amman Sugars Ltd., one of South India's prominent sugar manufacturers, delivered its strongest quarterly performance in Q3 FY26, with net profit surging 68.00% year-on-year to ₹48.39 crores. The Coimbatore-based company, with a market capitalisation of ₹4,577 crores, saw revenues climb 52.84% YoY to ₹644.11 crores, marking record quarterly sales. However, despite the impressive operational performance, the stock trades at a demanding valuation of 38 times trailing earnings, nearly double the sugar sector average of 20 times, raising questions about sustainability and fair value. Time: 1 hour ago
